content.question: At a concert, a band is playing on a platform that extends <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet from a wall behind the band, and the platform is rising from ground level, as shown in the figure above. A light source is <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet from the wall, and the platform casts a lengthening shadow on the wall as the platform rises. At time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds, the platform is <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet above the ground, and the height of the shadow is <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> feet. The quantities are related by the equation <math alttext="the fraction 1 over L, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, h plus s, close parenthesis, equals, the fraction 1 over P, end fraction, times s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are constants. Which of the following best expresses the rate of change of <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to time in terms of the rate of change of <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to time?
